channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress, 27th July
item.description:
A tenant of 15 Hoxton Square has dumbed their mattress that is now being used for rough sleeping and other rubbish is starting to accumulate on it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hoxton Square, Hackney, London

item.title: Overhanging tree branch on pavement causing prams & wheelchairs restricted access., 27th July
item.description:

item.title: Huge amount of litter at mini recycling area, 27th July
item.description:
This accumulation of litter is just the other side of the children’s play area at Falconwood Parade. A potential breeding ground for vermin. Surely it’s not beyond the Council’s capabilities to move the recycling bins out and clear away this rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21,23, Falconwood Parade, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge amount of tree produce, 27th July
item.description:
The tree has dropped a large amount of what looks like plums, which has covered the pavement completely causing a hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mungo Park Way, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White goods still awaiting council collection, 27th July
item.description:
The cricket club has asked the council on multiple occasions to collect the old white goods currently sat outside the pavilion. The council say they will, but this has been going on since before 17April (that’s now over 3 months!). Leaving these on show is making the neighbourhood look bad. Please can the council prioritise this collection.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalk Lane, Cockfosters, London
Report on FixMyStreet
